medical_history.chief_complaint: Signs of aromatase deficiency and virilization in a 46, XX patient.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Maternal virilization occurred from the 6th month of pregnancy with symptoms including acne, hirsutism, clitoris growth, and voice deepening that regressed post-partum. The patient displayed ambiguous genitalia at birth, which included clitoris hypertrophy that regressed by three months of age. Initial testosterone and 17-OH-P levels were elevated at seven days but diminished progressively.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was born at term; no significant clinical manifestations were reported following a genitoplasty at 13 months. Hormone levels showed an elevated 17-OH-P at 8 years, with normal adrenal function indicated by normal cortisol and ACTH.
medical_history.family_history: The mother exhibited virilization symptoms and both the child and fetus showed signs related to aromatase deficiency. The father and a younger brother are carriers of the identified variants.
